00001 #ifndef _ESM_LOCKS_H
00002 #define _ESM_LOCKS_H
00003 
00004 #include "esm_reader.hpp"
00005 
00006 namespace ESM {
00007 
00008 /*
00009  * This file covers lockpicks (LOCK), probes (PROB) and armor repair
00010  * items (REPA). These have nearly identical data structures.
00011  */
00012 
00013 struct Tool
00014 {
00015   struct Data
00016   {
00017     float weight;
00018     int value;
00019 
00020     float quality; // And when I say nearly identical structure, I
00021     int uses;      // mean perfectly identical except that these two
00022                    // variables are swaped for repair items. Don't ask
00023                    // me why.
00024   }; // Size = 16
00025 
00026   Data data;
00027   std::string name, model, icon, script;
00028 
00029   void load(ESMReader &esm)
00030   {
00031     model = esm.getHNString("MODL");
00032     name = esm.getHNString("FNAM");
00033 
00034     esm.getSubName();
00035     NAME n = esm.retSubName();
00036     // The data name varies, RIDT for repair items, LKDT for lock
00037     // picks, PBDT for probes
00038 
00039     esm.getHT(data, 16);
00040 
00041     if(n == "RIDT")
00042       {
00043         // Swap t.data.quality and t.data.uses for repair items (sigh)
00044         float tmp = *((float*)&data.uses);
00045         data.uses = *((int*)&data.quality);
00046         data.quality = tmp;
00047       }
00048 
00049     script = esm.getHNOString("SCRI");
00050     icon = esm.getHNOString("ITEX");
00051   }
00052 };
00053 
00054 struct Probe : Tool
00055 {
00056 
00057 };
00058 
00059 struct Repair : Tool
00060 {
00061 
00062 };
00063 
00064 }
00065 #endif
